p:
Looking at the reaction network ( Figure A8), we can see again a reaction for infection, i.e., the transformation of healthy cells H into infected cells I catalyzed by viruses V at a rate
γ
H V
V H
(single underlined in Figure 12a). Furthermore, interferon F is produced catalytically by antigen presenting M and infected cells I, decays spontaneously at a rate
a F
F
, and is additionally removed when converting healthy cells H into resistant cells R by the reaction
H + F → R
at rate
b
H F
F H
(double underlined in Figure 12a).
